Package project2

Class Date

java.lang.Object
project2.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends Object
implements Comparable<Date>
The date class creates a date, that date being todays date by default or a specific date. The date class can create those dates and check if those dates are real and compare two dates.
Author:
Manav Bali, Daniel Lopez

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date​(String date)
      Separates the string into the correct instance variable. Creates a date object.
      Parameters:
      date - the specific date.

    • Date

      public Date()
      Creates a default date with that date being todays date. Creates a date object.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Grabs the current instances of date and returns a string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string of date.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks the date to see if its a real date. Checks for future dates and dates that don't follows the rules of the months/days. Dates before 1980 will not be accepted and dates past todays date will also not be accepted.
      Returns:
      true is date is valid, false otherwise.

    • leapYear

      public boolean leapYear()
      Checks to see if the year is a leap year.
      Returns:
      true if leap year, false otherwise

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date date)
      Compares two dates.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - the date to be compared.
      Returns:
      int 1 if bigger, 0 if the same, -1 if smaller.
